ReferenceError.what: Variable or function is used before it's declared or doesn't exist
ReferenceError.why: The code references a name that hasn't been defined in the current scope
fix: Check if the variable/function name is spelled correctly
Ensure the variable is declared before use (use const/let/var)
Verify imports if it's from another module
Check variable scope (global vs local)

TypeError.what: Operation performed on wrong data type or null/undefined value
TypeError.why: Trying to access properties or methods on undefined/null or incompatible types
fix: Add null/undefined checks before accessing properties
Use optional chaining (?.) to safely access nested properties
Verify the variable has the expected type before operations
Check if objects/arrays are initialized before use

SyntaxError.why: Code doesn't follow JavaScript grammar rules
fix: Check for missing brackets, parentheses, or quotes
Verify semicolons are used correctly
Look for typos in keywords (const vs var, function vs fn)
Check for unclosed strings or template literals

RangeError.why: Numeric value exceeds limits or array index is invalid
fix: Check array indices are within bounds (0 to length-1)
Verify numeric values are within expected ranges
Use array.length checks before accessing elements

EvalError.why: Invalid code passed to eval() or eval() not allowed in strict mode
fix: Avoid using eval() - use safer alternatives
If necessary, validate input before passing to eval()
Consider using Function constructor or JSON.parse() instead

URIError.why: Malformed URI passed to encodeURI/decodeURI functions
fix: Validate URI strings before encoding/decoding
Use try-catch around URI operations
Check URI format matches expected pattern
